heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 07 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (192°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.7°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 8%) and rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.2°C) and feels like temperature (up 3.6°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 858.4m higher than yesterday, 680.2m higher than the past week, 48.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 1181m to 2400m and averaged 2460m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and bright sunshine will dominate the day. Changeable conditions.
